The ShAK-12, (Russian: Ўј -12) originally under the name ASh-12.7 (јЎ-12.7, which stands for "јвтомат штурмовой 12.7мм" or "automatic assault 12.7mm") battle rifle is a dedicated CQB/Urban Operations weapon, developed by TsKIB SOO ("Central Design and Research Bureau of Sporting and Hunting Arms"), a subsidiary of the KBP Instrument Design Bureau of Tula, Russia. 
 
 The weapon was designed with extreme short-range stopping power in mind for urban combat. The ShAK-12 features a bullpup layout, with a stamped steel receiver and a polymer housing/stock. Firing controls include two separate levers; a fire mode selector (Semi/Auto) at the rear and an ambidextrous safety (Safe/Fire) above the pistol grip. 
 
 There are several configurations of the basic rifle. This tactical version features a "flat top" configuration with a Picatinny rail running on top of the receiver, and an AN/PEQ-15 (ATPIAL) in battle grey with a green laser.

 %c[d_purple] Х %c[ui_gray_2] Permanent: AN/PEQ-15 (ATPIAL), for scopes with magnification: Trijicon RMR Red Dot Sight installed on a 45∞ mount
 
 %c[d_purple] Х %c[ui_gray_2] Scopes (Bas): almost all colimators and scopes (no sniper scopes) 
 
 %c[d_purple] Х %c[ui_gray_2] Silencer: KZRZP suppressor

The ShAK-12, (Russian: Ўј -12) originally under the name ASh-12.7 (јЎ-12.7, which stands for "јвтомат штурмовой 12.7мм" or "automatic assault 12.7mm") battle rifle is a dedicated CQB/Urban Operations weapon, developed by TsKIB SOO ("Central Design and Research Bureau of Sporting and Hunting Arms"), a subsidiary of the KBP Instrument Design Bureau of Tula, Russia. 
 
 The weapon was designed with extreme short-range stopping power in mind for urban combat. The ShAK-12 features a bullpup layout, with a stamped steel receiver and a polymer housing/stock. Firing controls include two separate levers; a fire mode selector (Semi/Auto) at the rear and an ambidextrous safety (Safe/Fire) above the pistol grip. 
 
 There are several configurations of the basic rifle. This tactical version features a "flat top" configuration with a Picatinny rail running on top of the receiver, and an AN/PEQ-15 (ATPIAL) in battle grey with a green laser. 
 
 The Operator variant adds a Zenitco DTK-1L muzzle break requiring an advanced silencer. Furhtermore it sports an EOTECH Vudu 1-6x24 FFP rifle scope. The EOTECH Speed Ring reticle allows for fast target engagement at low power, but at higher power provides the resolution and accuracy required to tackle longer shots. The Vudu 1-6X is the perfect solution for short- to medium-range applications.
